title: Debate Over Paid Family Leave Is Louder Than Ever
sub_head: As Washington weighs possible new national policy, Americans take to social media to express their views
body:
Democrats might have dropped plans to include a paid-leave program in their $1.85 trillion climate and social-spending bill, but discussions on the issue are continuing well beyond Capitol Hill.
Many Americans took to Twitter and other social-media platforms this week to share their thoughts on paid family leave, already a hot topic of conversation during the Covid-19 pandemic. Data points on Western countriesâ€™ policies circulated, and debates erupted at times over questions about taking a prolonged time off work.
